title: How to Make Cranberry Cheesecake

steps.headline: In a large bowl, combine the graham cracker crumbs, sugar, melted butter and walnuts (if desired) until well mixed.
Spoon the mixture into a 10-inch spring form pan.
Spread and press graham cracker mixture until the bottom of the pan is covered evenly.
steps.description: Don't shy away from pressing hard. You want to make sure it's packed well together.

steps.headline: In a large bowl, cream together the cream cheese, salt and sugar with a mixer on low speed until light and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs, cornstarch and nutmeg.
Pour the cream cheese mixture into the graham cracker crust.
Pour the cranberry sauce in a blender and pulse until smooth.
steps.description: Add in the walnuts and orange zest and mix well.

steps.headline: Spoon the cranberry mixture on top of the cheesecake.
steps.description: Swirl the cranberries into the cheesecake using a spatula or knife.

steps.headline: Bake for  45 minutes to 1 hour or until done.
Remove from the oven and allow to cool completely and then place in the refrigerator to further chill.

text: Crust In a large bowl, combine the graham cracker crumbs, sugar, melted butter and walnuts (if desired) until well mixed.  Spoon the mixture into a 10-inch spring form pan.  Spread and press graham cracker mixture until the bottom of the pan is covered evenly. Don't shy away from pressing hard. You want to make sure it's packed well together. Cheesecake In a large bowl, cream together the cream cheese, salt and sugar with a mixer on low speed until light and fluffy.  Beat in the eggs, cornstarch and nutmeg.  Pour the cream cheese mixture into the graham cracker crust. Spread the mixture around evenly. Cranberry Topping Pour the cranberry sauce in a blender and pulse until smooth. Add in the walnuts and orange zest and mix well. Spoon the cranberry mixture on top of the cheesecake. Swirl the cranberries into the cheesecake using a spatula or knife. Bake for  45 minutes to 1 hour or until done.  Remove from the oven and allow to cool completely and then place in the refrigerator to further chill.  Slice and serve chilled.
